programme.title: Baggage Battles
programme.desc: Blow Up. The baggage battlers head to an unclaimed crate auction Tucson, Arizona and things really heat up when one of the experts tests a vintage bomb detonator. S3, Ep4

programme.title: Baggage Battles
programme.desc: Mike Tyson's Punch Out. The baggage battlers head to an estate auction in Jacksonville, Florida, where pop culture collectibles and sealed boxes are amongst the items on offer. S3, Ep5

programme.title: Baggage Battles
programme.desc: Space Case. The baggage battlers head to a government auction in Sacramento, California. Mark Meyer cuts into the Martin's profit by bidding high on a box of knives. S3, Ep6

programme.title: Baggage Battles
programme.desc: Two-Faced. The baggage battlers head to a police auction in Stockton, California, where one of the auction specialists discover a mask mould of a famous Hollywood icon. S3, Ep7

programme.title: Baggage Battles
programme.desc: Guns a-Blazin'. The baggage battlers head to a cowboy auction in California, where they duel over items dating back to the legendary Buffalo Bill and the Barnum & Bailey circuses. S3, Ep8

programme.title: Baggage Battles
programme.desc: Platinum Hits. The baggage battlers head to a music icons auction in New York. They find a gold disc for the Pink Floyd album 'Dark Side Of The Moon' and a nude photo of Madonna. S3, Ep9

programme.title: Junkyard Empire
programme.desc: Mustang Time Machine. Dave Jensen asks Andy to restore his dad's 1964 Mustang. Plus, Jen wants to sell her Jeep but when Andy decides to fix it up, she throws a wrench in his plans. S4, Ep9

programme.title: Junkyard Empire
programme.desc: Wrecked Wrangler Rehab. Andy and his dad Bobby restore a couple of classics: A Jeep Wrangler that's an American icon, and a 1986 Monte Carlo once known as 'The Heartbeat of America.' S4, Ep10

programme.title: Junkyard Empire
programme.desc: Junkyard Driftin'. Andy squeezes a Hemi engine into a Jeep Wrangler for a power boost. Jeff revives an '86 RX-7 with a Corvette LT1 motor, and Tim rehabs a trashed Boston Whaler. S4, Ep11

programme.title: Junkyard Empire
programme.desc: Father-Son Run. When Andy has another try at the world speed record for tow trucks in his Racing Wrecker, Bobby plans to take him on in a 1979 Zephyr with a hot new engine. S4, Ep12

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Jag E-Type. This classic Jag is one of the best-looking cars in the world and Mike gladly takes a risk on a wreck. But the price of parts is huge - will the project crash and burn? S8, Ep1

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Frogeye Sprite. Mike attempts to double his money by turning an old Frogeye Sprite into a premiership quality classic car to be test driven around the Brooklands Motor Museum. S8, Ep4

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Morgan. Mike is seduced by a stunning Morgan Plus 4 at only ¬£13,000, but it needs a new chassis and fitting it will take at least a hundred man hours. How will Edd react? S9, Ep2

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Caterham 7. Mike has always wanted to get an old Caterham into the workshop, but when Edd decides to take a risk by painting it a shocking colour will the risk pay off? S12, Ep13

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Lotus Europa. Mike returns Elvis to his F1 roots with a car from a big name in British racing: a Lotus Europa. Elvis is excited - until he takes it out for a spin. S17, Ep8

programme.title: In Search Of Monsters
programme.desc: Chupacabra. Experts analyse new evidence that could prove the legendary bloodsucking beast known as Chupacabra is real, and that there are two versions of the creature! S1, Ep8

programme.title: In Search Of Monsters
programme.desc: The Ozark Howler. Recently disclosed audio recordings and astonishing photographs may provide the most conclusive evidence to date that the Ozark Howler may have demonic origins. S1, Ep9

programme.title: Mystery At Blind Frog Ranch
programme.desc: $3 Billion Heist. Duane and Chad Ollinger return to the Ranch to unearth $3 billion in hidden treasure. Claim jumpers invade the property, threatening to derail everything. S3, Ep1

programme.title: Mystery At Blind Frog Ranch
programme.desc: Underground Tsunami. Searching for the hidden entrance to the cave system, the team finds an ancient vent shaft above the Energy Zone but are thrown off by an explosion. S3, Ep2

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Gates Excitation: The guys do everything in their power to meet Bill Gates when his firm has dealings with the pharmaceutical company Penny works for.

programme.title: Shrek Forever After
programme.desc: (2010) Animated adventure. In the ogre's fourth feature-length escapade, Shrek makes an unwise bargain with Rumpelstiltskin. With the voices of Mike Myers, Cameron Diaz and Eddie Murphy.

programme.title: The Simpsons Movie
programme.desc: (2007) Animated comedy. When Homer's love for a pig causes world-threatening pollution, Springfield gets enclosed in a huge dome. D'oh! Will he do the decent thing and save his neighbours?

programme.title: The Simpsons Go Inter-DOHmentional
programme.desc: Clown in the Dumps: Enjoy a night of weird and far out episodes! Krusty loses confidence and retires from showbusiness after his dad dies without ever approving of his career.

programme.title: The Simpsons Go Inter-DOHmentional
programme.desc: The Good, the Sad and the Drugly: A volunteer inspires Bart to become a better person. Lisa writes an essay about what Springfield will be like in 50 years.

programme.title: The Simpsons Go Inter-DOHmentional
programme.desc: The Springfield Files: Homer thinks he's seen an alien in the woods. This could be a case for Mulder and Scully (guest stars David Duchovny and Gillian Anderson).

programme.title: The Simpsons Go Inter-DOHmentional
programme.desc: El Viaje Misterioso de Nuestro Jomer (The Mysterious Voyage of Our Homer): Homer eats a dangerous chilli, has a hallucinogenic trip and meets a talking coyote (Johnny Cash).

programme.title: The Simpsons Go Inter-DOHmentional
programme.desc: Mathlete's Feat: Groundskeeper Willie coaches Lisa and the school Mathlympics team for an important maths quiz.

programme.title: New: Rick and Morty
programme.desc: Brand new series - Valkyrick: Rick and Morty series eight continues! In this episode, Space Beth needs a hand at work.

programme.title: Rick and Morty
programme.desc: Brand new series - Summer of All Fears: Another chance to see the first episode of the brand spanking new series. In this opening episode, Rick tries to discipline the kids.

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: Britain's sharpest TV critics have been watching: The Great British Bake Off, Vigil, Sex Actually with Alice Levine, This Morning, ITV News (travel), and BBC News (gas crisis).

programme.title: Prince Valiant
programme.desc: (1954) Swashbuckling adventure. One of King Arthur's courtiers, the Viking Prince Valiant (Robert Wagner) uncovers the evil Sir Brack's (James Mason) plot to kill the king. Can he foil him?

programme.desc: (1955) Atmospheric Victorian melodrama. Stewart Granger plays a sinister aristocrat who poisons his wife. However, his maid (Jean Simmons) knows his secret and tries to use it against him.

programme.title: The Iron Petticoat
programme.desc: (1956) Comedy with Katharine Hepburn and Bob Hope. A Russian captain defects to London, falls for the charms of Major Lockwood, and tries to convince him of the beauty of communism.

programme.title: 10 Things I Hate About You
programme.desc: (1999) Teen comedy with Julia Stiles and Heath Ledger. A student is furious to discover her prom date was bribed by her sister to invite her. But confusion ensues when he falls for her.

programme.title: John Wick: Chapter 3 - Parabellum
programme.desc: (2019) Keanu Reeves returns for the third time as the supposedly retired hitman. This time, someone's put a contract on John Wick's head and only a mystic in Morocco can lift it.

programme.title: Smile
programme.desc: (2022) Gory horror with Sosie Bacon. Following a traumatic incident, a psychiatrist is haunted by a malevolent, gurning presence that drives people to gruesomely kill themselves. Or is she?

programme.desc: (2020) Darkly comic teen horror. Will a spate of unexplained spontaneous combustions affect Mara and Dylan's romance? Strong language/gore/drugs.

programme.title: Minority Report
programme.desc: Futuristic action thriller from director Steven Spielberg, based on the Philip K Dick short story, starring Tom Cruise, Colin Farrell and Samantha Morton. In the mid-21st century, John Anderton is in charge of the Justice Department's Precrime unit, an elite force that can predict offences and make arrests before the crimes are committed. But Anderton's life falls apart when he is labelled a future murderer and forced to go on the run to clear his name.

programme.title: TikTok: Murder Gone Viral
programme.desc: Documentary exploring true-crime cases linked to the social-media platform. In the early hours of February 11, 2022, 21-year-olds Saqib Hussain and Hashim Ijazuddin were found dead in a burning car on the A46 in Leicestershire. Within a short time, police arrested 22-year-old TikTok influencer Mahek Bukhari and her 45-year-old mother Ansreen, who it turned out had been in a secret relationship with Saqib that began when he was just 18

programme.title: Unwind with STV
programme.desc: Daily escape designed to calm the mind and encourage relaxation and reflection

programme.title: Jimmy & Shivi's Farmhouse Breakfast
programme.desc: Jimmy Doherty and Shivi Ramoutar are joind by comedian and actress Donna Preston, who samples savoury bread and butter pudding for breakfast. Jimmy makes a puzzle board for the raccoons while at the wildlife park, and Shivi meets a man who set up a coffee business for a noble cause

programme.title: Good Morning Britain
programme.desc: Morning magazine featuring a lively mix of news and current affairs, plus health, entertainment and lifestyle features

programme.title: Lorraine
programme.desc: Early morning chat show presented by Lorraine Kelly, with celebrity interviews, entertainment news, cooking tips, fashion features and musical guests.

programme.title: This Morning
programme.desc: Daily magazine, featuring a mix of celebrity chat, showbusiness news, lifestyle features, topical discussion, health and beauty advice and more

programme.title: ITV Lunchtime News
programme.desc: The key headlines from the day so far

programme.title: STV News and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast

programme.title: STV Racing Live: The Oaks
programme.desc: Ed Chamberlin and Francesca Cumani present live coverage of the first day of the Derby meeting from Epsom, headlined by The Oaks. With analysis from Jason Weaver and Johnny Murtagh, reports by Matt Chapman, Rishi Persad, Adele Mulrennan and Mick Fitzgerald, betting news from Brian Gleeson and commentary by Richard Hoiles, while Oli Bell and Sam Quek take in the best of the action away from the racecourse

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as Tom from Oswestry, Laura from Durham, Pete from Bristol and Annmaria from Denbighshire pit their wits against one of the ruthless Chasers in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught

programme.title: STV News at Six and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast

programme.title: ITV Evening News
programme.desc: A round-up of the day's news headlines and talking points from the UK and around the world

programme.title: What's on Scotland
programme.desc: Movie news, chat about favourite TV programmes, and music. Plus, catch-ups with some of the biggest names in worldwide entertainment

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Cain is still reeling, while DC Cole reveals there has been a development in Nate's case. Sarah's birthday is not a happy day and a resolution is found for Pollard

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: George faces an uncertain future when Eileen decides to accept Jason's offer of a new life in Thailand, Millie refuses to go home without Theo, Dylan intervenes in Betsy and Brody's row, and Dee-Dee is shocked by James and Laila's unexpected return

programme.title: Joanna Lumley's Danube
programme.desc: The last leg of Joanna's Danube journey takes her across Romania, starting at the vast Iron Gates gorge. The actress travels into wild Transylvania, where she follows the trails of brown bears in the forest and discovers the secret history of Dracula's castle. After a night in a guest house owned by King Charles and an encounter with Europe's witches, Joanna heads towards the Danube Delta, the Black Sea, and the finale of her adventure

programme.title: ITV News at Ten
programme.desc: A fresh perspective on the major stories of the day, featuring national and international news, with reports and analysis from ITV's correspondents

programme.title: Goldfinger
programme.desc: Spy adventure starring Sean Connery. Agent 007 James Bond investigates ruthless criminal Auric Goldfinger, a man with an insatiable appetite for gold and a desire to become the most powerful man on Earth.

programme.title: Mel Giedroyc and Martin Clunes Explore Britain by the Book
programme.desc: The acting friends head to Dorset to explore the spectacular scenery and locations made famous by some of Britain's favourite books and films. They walk in the footsteps of Meryl Streep's French Lieutenant's Woman, stoke up the engine on a steam train ride through Enid Blyton country and take a boat trip to the world-famous Durdle Door on the breathtaking Jurassic coast, which proves challenging for the sea-sick Mel despite Martin's best efforts at distracting her by reading bursts of Thomas Hardy

programme.desc: Daily escape designed to calm the mind and encourage relaxation and reflection

programme.title: Katie Piper's Weekend Escape
programme.desc: Katie is joined by actress Fiona Wade, while hairdresser Michael Douglas and make-up artist Genevieve Turley transform the style of an endometriosis campaigner. Aldo Zilli rustles up mocktails and joins Katie for an ice bath

programme.title: Love Your Garden
programme.desc: Alan Titchmarsh heads to Swindon to surprise Lorraine, a retired RAF servicewoman and devoted charity volunteer. Because of a spinal injury, Lorraine struggles with mobility issues and lives with her full-time support team - Leonbergers Poppy and Doris. Poppy is a retired therapy dog and Doris is Lorraine's assistance dog, and helps with chores such as laundry and fetching household items. The team creates a fabulous low-maintenance garden as a calming retreat for both Lorraine and her canine family

programme.title: Love Your Weekend with Alan Titchmarsh

programme.title: Jimmy & Shivi's Farmhouse Breakfast

programme.title: European Qualifier
programme.desc: Andorra v England (Kick-off 5.00pm). Mark Pougatch presents all the action from the FIFA World Cup Group K qualifier at RCDE Stadium in Barcelona. England got off to a perfect start to their campaign and Thomas Tuchel's reign as manager with home wins against Albania and Latvia, as Harry Kane extended his record number of England goals with a strike in each game. They will expect nothing less than another win against Andorra, who have already lost to both the teams the Three Lions defeated. With analysis from Roy Keane and Karen Carney, and commentary by Sam Matterface and Lee Dixon

programme.title: Deal or No Deal for Soccer Aid
programme.desc: Stephen Mulhern hosts a special charity edition as The Last Leg co-host Alex Brooker goes up against the infamous Banker, supported on the wings by his Soccer Aid family. Can Alex choose the right boxes and resist the tempting cash offers until just the right moment to bag a huge cash prize for Unicef?

programme.title: The 1% Club for Soccer Aid
programme.desc: Lee Mack hosts a special charity edition of the quiz in which the questions have nothing to do with remembering facts, but are all about logic and common sense. A hundred sports stars and celebrities begin the show, but who will make it to the end and win up to ¬£100,000 for charity

programme.title: It'll Be Alright on the Night
programme.desc: David Walliams narrates a selection of behind-the-scenes bloopers and live broadcast blunders, with out-takes from Strictly Come Dancing, Blankety Blank, Coronation Street, Emmerdale, Antiques Road Trip, Love Island and many more

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Fake
programme.desc: While Birdie is at the airport waiting for Joe, he joins his other girlfriend Kirsty at a couples counselling session, secretly visits his mum at her nursing home without his brothers knowing and refuses to sign divorce papers when his ex-wife Mary suddenly arrives. He then tries to save his family home by bidding on it at auction with money he doesn't have

programme.title: Road to Perdition
programme.desc: Period crime drama starring Tom Hanks and Paul Newman. The Midwest in the 1930s: when the profession of ruthless hitman Michael Sullivan is discovered, a killer is sent to eradicate him and his family. But Sullivan and his 12-year-old son escape and embark upon a life-changing journey of revenge.

programme.title: Dame Maggie Smith: A Celebration
programme.desc: A tribute to the celebrated and enigmatic actress, with her life story told by those who knew her best, celebrating her much-loved appearances across film and TV spanning almost 70 years. Smith, who died in September 2024, had gained a new level of popularity playing the razor-tongued Lady Violet Crawley in Downton Abbey, but for all her success, remained a very private person who had little time for the trappings that came with fame. The film tells the story of a girl born in pre-war Essex who, against the odds, took Broadway and the West End by storm before eventually becoming one of the world's most popular and respected performers

programme.title: Unwind with STV
programme.desc: Daily escape designed to calm the mind and encourage relaxation and reflection

programme.title: Gary Barlow's Food and Wine Tour: Australia
programme.desc: Gary is in South Australia to meet his old friend Andi Peters. Starting their journey at the Yalumba Winery in the Barossa Valley, the duo try barrel-making, encounter the rare bees of Kangaroo Island, and visit the famous McLaren Vale, before blending their own vino with the Willy Wonka of Wine

programme.title: In for a Penny
programme.desc: Stephen Mulhern hosts the game show in which he travels around the UK setting members of the public unusual challenges, featuring the return of Roll It and phone game Left Hanging as well as the chance for people to win a thousand pounds in In for A Penny, In for a Grand

programme.desc: James looks forward to Soccer Aid 2025 with Harry Redknapp, cooks for classical singer Carly Paoli and enjoys recipes from chefs Sally Abe and Daniel Clifford

programme.title: Love Your Weekend with Alan Titchmarsh
programme.desc: The host is joined by actress Barbara Flynn and The Repair Shop stars Julie Tatchell and Amanda Middleditch. Alan also gets a masterclass in milking goats, surveys some vintage bicycles and samples the best red wines for summer

programme.title: Jeremy Pang's Hong Kong Kitchen
programme.desc: Jeremy is joined by businessman and good friend Tom Skinner to enjoy Hong Kong's nod to an English fry-up and go on the ultimate street food tour around the central part of the city. Tom also gets to experience Hong Kong's famous fish market, which ends with a royal banquet, and is set up with a surprise visit to the city's oldest stamp carver and curator for a little holiday memento. Along the way, Jeremy's recipes include cheung fun, a savoury doughnut topped with a sweetened soy sauce

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Alan Titchmarsh's Gardening Club
programme.desc: Camilla Bassett-Smith explores a historic Scottish palace and gardens, Henry Agg builds a DIY pergola, Martha Swales offers a special allotment tour with her dad, and Errol Reuben Fernandes visits a unique Berkshire garden

programme.title: Jumanji
programme.desc: Fantasy adventure starring Robin Williams. In 1969, a young boy called Alan gets trapped in the strange jungle world of a magical board game he has unearthed on a building site. Twenty-six years later, two children discover the game and unwittingly unleash its dangerous magic. They also release Alan, now an adult, who realises that to escape the game they must play it to the end.

programme.title: You Only Live Twice
programme.desc: Spy adventure starring Sean Connery and Donald Pleasence. When international crime syndicate Spectre captures an American spaceship in the hope of starting the Third World War, James Bond is dispatched to Japan to face arch villain Blofeld, the man behind the evil scheme.

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Sean's Scotland
programme.desc: Sean Batty travels to the Black Isle, where he visits a local brewery and the Cromarty Community Cinema before going dolphin watching and finding out about Scotland's first managed coastal realignment.

programme.title: The People's History Show
programme.desc: Fergus Sutherland explores his home town of Cumbernauld, and Jennifer Reoch goes to Benbecula to find out about the time a grizzly bear called Hercules went missing on the island

programme.title: UEFA Nations League Final
programme.desc: Mark Pougatch presents coverage of the showpiece match (Kick-off 8.00pm), which sees Germany or Portugal face Spain or France at Allianz Arena in Munich. Spain won this tournament two years ago, defeating Croatia on penalties in the final after Unai Sim√≥n saved from Lovro Majer and Bruno Petkovic. They have since won Euro 2024 and went into the semi-finals looking for yet another title. With analysis from Karen Carney and Guillem Balague, and commentary by Seb Hutchinson and Andros Townsend

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Love Island: Decade of Love
programme.desc: Memorable contestants from the past decade of Love Island reunite for an unmissable anniversary event, from explosive recouplings and shock bombshells to the love stories that captured the nation. They reflect on unforgettable moments from the villa and look back at previously unseen audition clips

programme.title: Minority Report
programme.desc: Futuristic action thriller from director Steven Spielberg, based on the Philip K Dick short story, starring Tom Cruise, Colin Farrell and Samantha Morton. In the mid-21st century, John Anderton is in charge of the Justice Department's Precrime unit, an elite force that can predict offences and make arrests before the crimes are committed. But Anderton's life falls apart when he is labelled a future murderer and forced to go on the run to clear his name.

programme.title: TikTok: Murder Gone Viral
programme.desc: Documentary exploring true-crime cases linked to the social-media platform. In the early hours of February 11, 2022, 21-year-olds Saqib Hussain and Hashim Ijazuddin were found dead in a burning car on the A46 in Leicestershire. Within a short time, police arrested 22-year-old TikTok influencer Mahek Bukhari and her 45-year-old mother Ansreen, who it turned out had been in a secret relationship with Saqib that began when he was just 18

programme.title: Mel Giedroyc and Martin Clunes Explore Britain by the Book
programme.desc: The acting friends head to Dorset to explore the spectacular scenery and locations made famous by some of Britain's favourite books and films. They walk in the footsteps of Meryl Streep's French Lieutenant's Woman, stoke up the engine on a steam train ride through Enid Blyton country and take a boat trip to the world-famous Durdle Door on the breathtaking Jurassic coast, which proves challenging for the sea-sick Mel despite Martin's best efforts at distracting her by reading bursts of Thomas Hardy

programme.title: Unwind with STV
programme.desc: Daily escape designed to calm the mind and encourage relaxation and reflection

programme.title: Katie Piper's Weekend Escape
programme.desc: Katie is joined by actress Fiona Wade, while hairdresser Michael Douglas and make-up artist Genevieve Turley transform the style of an endometriosis campaigner. Aldo Zilli rustles up mocktails and joins Katie for an ice bath

programme.title: Love Your Garden
programme.desc: Alan Titchmarsh heads to Swindon to surprise Lorraine, a retired RAF servicewoman and devoted charity volunteer. Because of a spinal injury, Lorraine struggles with mobility issues and lives with her full-time support team - Leonbergers Poppy and Doris. Poppy is a retired therapy dog and Doris is Lorraine's assistance dog, and helps with chores such as laundry and fetching household items. The team creates a fabulous low-maintenance garden as a calming retreat for both Lorraine and her canine family

programme.title: Love Your Weekend with Alan Titchmarsh
programme.desc: Joining Alan at Manor Farm are Anita Dobson, Tom Allen and Amol Rajan, while horticulturalist Camilla Bassett-Smith opens the pages of her summer diary. There is a catch-up with the brown bears currently residing at Jimmy's farm, while Andy Clarke has the best in festival drinks and nibbles

programme.title: Jimmy & Shivi's Farmhouse Breakfast
programme.desc: Jimmy Doherty and Shivi Ramoutar are joined by singer, actress and presenter Toyah Willcox. It's time to spruce up the guinea pig enclosure at the wildlife park and test out some TikTok cooking hacks back in the kitchen, while local upcycler Sarah joins the trio to show everyone how to glam up their lampshades

programme.title: STV Racing Live: The Derby
programme.desc: Coverage of day two of the Derby meeting from Epsom, headlined by The Derby

programme.title: European Qualifier
programme.desc: Andorra v England (Kick-off 5.00pm). Mark Pougatch presents all the action from the FIFA World Cup Group K qualifier at RCDE Stadium in Barcelona. England got off to a perfect start to their campaign and Thomas Tuchel's reign as manager with home wins against Albania and Latvia, as Harry Kane extended his record number of England goals with a strike in each game. They will expect nothing less than another win against Andorra, who have already lost to both the teams the Three Lions defeated. With analysis from Roy Keane and Karen Carney, and commentary by Sam Matterface and Lee Dixon

programme.title: Deal or No Deal for Soccer Aid
programme.desc: Stephen Mulhern hosts a special charity edition as The Last Leg co-host Alex Brooker goes up against the infamous Banker, supported on the wings by his Soccer Aid family. Can Alex choose the right boxes and resist the tempting cash offers until just the right moment to bag a huge cash prize for Unicef?

programme.title: The 1% Club for Soccer Aid
programme.desc: Lee Mack hosts a special charity edition of the quiz in which the questions have nothing to do with remembering facts, but are all about logic and common sense. A hundred sports stars and celebrities begin the show, but who will make it to the end and win up to ¬£100,000 for charity

programme.title: It'll Be Alright on the Night
programme.desc: David Walliams narrates a selection of behind-the-scenes bloopers and live broadcast blunders, with out-takes from Strictly Come Dancing, Blankety Blank, Coronation Street, Emmerdale, Antiques Road Trip, Love Island and many more

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Fake
programme.desc: While Birdie is at the airport waiting for Joe, he joins his other girlfriend Kirsty at a couples counselling session, secretly visits his mum at her nursing home without his brothers knowing and refuses to sign divorce papers when his ex-wife Mary suddenly arrives. He then tries to save his family home by bidding on it at auction with money he doesn't have

programme.title: Road to Perdition
programme.desc: Period crime drama starring Tom Hanks and Paul Newman. The Midwest in the 1930s: when the profession of ruthless hitman Michael Sullivan is discovered, a killer is sent to eradicate him and his family. But Sullivan and his 12-year-old son escape and embark upon a life-changing journey of revenge.

programme.title: Dame Maggie Smith: A Celebration
programme.desc: A tribute to the celebrated and enigmatic actress, with her life story told by those who knew her best, celebrating her much-loved appearances across film and TV spanning almost 70 years. Smith, who died in September 2024, had gained a new level of popularity playing the razor-tongued Lady Violet Crawley in Downton Abbey, but for all her success, remained a very private person who had little time for the trappings that came with fame. The film tells the story of a girl born in pre-war Essex who, against the odds, took Broadway and the West End by storm before eventually becoming one of the world's most popular and respected performers

programme.title: Unwind with STV
programme.desc: Daily escape designed to calm the mind and encourage relaxation and reflection

programme.title: Gary Barlow's Food and Wine Tour: Australia
programme.desc: Gary is in South Australia to meet his old friend Andi Peters. programme.desc: The host is joined by actress Barbara Flynn and The Repair Shop stars Julie Tatchell and Amanda Middleditch. Alan also gets a masterclass in milking goats, surveys some vintage bicycles and samples the best red wines for summer

programme.title: Jeremy Pang's Hong Kong Kitchen
programme.desc: Jeremy is joined by businessman and good friend Tom Skinner to enjoy Hong Kong's nod to an English fry-up and go on the ultimate street food tour around the central part of the city. Tom also gets to experience Hong Kong's famous fish market, which ends with a royal banquet, and is set up with a surprise visit to the city's oldest stamp carver and curator for a little holiday memento. Along the way, Jeremy's recipes include cheung fun, a savoury doughnut topped with a sweetened soy sauce

programme.title: ITV News and Weather

programme.title: Alan Titchmarsh's Gardening Club
programme.desc: Camilla Bassett-Smith explores a historic Scottish palace and gardens, Henry Agg builds a DIY pergola, Martha Swales offers a special allotment tour with her dad, and Errol Reuben Fernandes visits a unique Berkshire garden

programme.title: Jumanji
programme.desc: Fantasy adventure starring Robin Williams. In 1969, a young boy called Alan gets trapped in the strange jungle world of a magical board game he has unearthed on a building site. Twenty-six years later, two children discover the game and unwittingly unleash its dangerous magic. They also release Alan, now an adult, who realises that to escape the game they must play it to the end.

programme.title: You Only Live Twice
programme.desc: Spy adventure starring Sean Connery and Donald Pleasence. When international crime syndicate Spectre captures an American spaceship in the hope of starting the Third World War, James Bond is dispatched to Japan to face arch villain Blofeld, the man behind the evil scheme.

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Sean's Scotland
programme.desc: Sean Batty travels to the Black Isle, where he visits a local brewery and the Cromarty Community Cinema before going dolphin watching and finding out about Scotland's first managed coastal realignment.

programme.title: The People's History Show
programme.desc: Fergus Sutherland explores his home town of Cumbernauld, and Jennifer Reoch goes to Benbecula to find out about the time a grizzly bear called Hercules went missing on the island

programme.title: UEFA Nations League Final
programme.desc: Mark Pougatch presents coverage of the showpiece match (Kick-off 8.00pm), which sees Germany or Portugal face Spain or France at Allianz Arena in Munich. Spain won this tournament two years ago, defeating Croatia on penalties in the final after Unai Sim√≥n saved from Lovro Majer and Bruno Petkovic. They have since won Euro 2024 and went into the semi-finals looking for yet another title. With analysis from Karen Carney and Guillem Balague, and commentary by Seb Hutchinson and Andros Townsend

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Love Island: Decade of Love
programme.desc: Memorable contestants from the past decade of Love Island reunite for an unmissable anniversary event, from explosive recouplings and shock bombshells to the love stories that captured the nation. They reflect on unforgettable moments from the villa and look back at previously unseen audition clips

programme.title: Minority Report
programme.desc: Futuristic action thriller from director Steven Spielberg, based on the Philip K Dick short story, starring Tom Cruise, Colin Farrell and Samantha Morton. In the mid-21st century, John Anderton is in charge of the Justice Department's Precrime unit, an elite force that can predict offences and make arrests before the crimes are committed. But Anderton's life falls apart when he is labelled a future murderer and forced to go on the run to clear his name.

programme.title: TikTok: Murder Gone Viral
programme.desc: Documentary exploring true-crime cases linked to the social-media platform. In the early hours of February 11, 2022, 21-year-olds Saqib Hussain and Hashim Ijazuddin were found dead in a burning car on the A46 in Leicestershire. Within a short time, police arrested 22-year-old TikTok influencer Mahek Bukhari and her 45-year-old mother Ansreen, who it turned out had been in a secret relationship with Saqib that began when he was just 18

With analysis from Jason Weaver and Johnny Murtagh, reports by Matt Chapman, Rishi Persad, Adele Mulrennan and Mick Fitzgerald, betting news from Brian Gleeson and commentary by Richard Hoiles, while Oli Bell and Sam Quek take in the best of the action away from the racecourse

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as Tom from Oswestry, Laura from Durham, Pete from Bristol and Annmaria from Denbighshire pit their wits against one of the ruthless Chasers in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. programme.title: Joanna Lumley's Danube
programme.desc: The last leg of Joanna's Danube journey takes her across Romania, starting at the vast Iron Gates gorge. The actress travels into wild Transylvania, where she follows the trails of brown bears in the forest and discovers the secret history of Dracula's castle. After a night in a guest house owned by King Charles and an encounter with Europe's witches, Joanna heads towards the Danube Delta, the Black Sea, and the finale of her adventure
